com.software.reuze

Interface mpb_i_NetworkDynamic

  • All Superinterfaces:
    mpb_i_Network
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    mpb_NetworkDynamic

    public interface mpb_i_NetworkDynamic
extends mpb_i_Network
    Artificial Intelligence A Modern Approach (3rd Edition): page 590.

    A dynamic Bayesian network, or DBN, is a Bayesian network that represents a temporal probability model. In general, each slice of a DBN can have any number of state variables XtEt. For simplicity, we assume that the variables and their links are exactly replicated from slice to slice and that the DBN represents a first-order Markov process, so that each variable can have parents only in its own slice or the immediately preceding slice.
    Author:
    Ciaran O'Reilly

    • Method Detail

      • getPriorNetwork

        mpb_i_Network getPriorNetwork()
        Returns:
        a Bayesian Network containing just the nodes representing the prior distribution (layer 0) of the dynamic bayesian network.

      • getX_0

        Set<mp_i_RandomVariable> getX_0()
        Returns:
        the set of state variables representing the prior distribution.

      • getX_1

        Set<mp_i_RandomVariable> getX_1()
        Returns:
        the set of state variables representing the first posterior slice of the DBN. This along with X0 should represent the transition model P(X1 | X0).

      • getX_1_VariablesInTopologicalOrder

        List<mp_i_RandomVariable> getX_1_VariablesInTopologicalOrder()
        Returns:
        the X_1 variables in topological order.

      • getX_0_to_X_1

        Map<mp_i_RandomVariable,mp_i_RandomVariable> getX_0_to_X_1()
        Returns:
        a Map indicating equivalent variables between X0 and X1.

      • getX_1_to_X_0

        Map<mp_i_RandomVariable,mp_i_RandomVariable> getX_1_to_X_0()
        Returns:
        a Map indicating equivalent variables between X1 and X0.

      • getE_1

        Set<mp_i_RandomVariable> getE_1()
        Returns:
        the set of state variables representing the evidence variables for the DBN. This along with X1 should represent the sensor model P(E1 | X1).
